first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
first_reading.text:
[[Gn 18,1]]The LORD appeared to Abraham by the terebinth of Mamre, as he sat in the entrance of his tent, while the day was growing hot.
[[Gn 18,2]]Looking up, he saw three men standing nearby. When he saw them, he ran from the entrance of the tent to greet them; and bowing to the ground,
[[Gn 18,3]]he said: "Sir, if I may ask you this favor, please do not go on past your servant.
[[Gn 18,4]]Let some water be brought, that you may bathe your feet, and then rest yourselves under the tree.
[[Gn 18,5]]Now that you have come this close to your servant, let me bring you a little food, that you may refresh yourselves; and afterward you may go on your way." "Very well," they replied, "do as you have said."
[[Gn 18,6]]Abraham hastened into the tent and told Sarah, "Quick, three seahs of fine flour! Knead it and make rolls."
[[Gn 18,7]]He ran to the herd, picked out a tender, choice steer, and gave it to a servant, who quickly prepared it.
[[Gn 18,8]]Then he got some curds and milk, as well as the steer that had been prepared, and set these before them; and he waited on them under the tree while they ate.
[[Gn 18,9]]"Where is your wife Sarah?" they asked him. "There in the tent," he replied.
[[Gn 18,10]]One of them said, "I will surely return to you about this time next year, and Sarah will then have a son."
[[Gn 18,11]]Now Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years, and Sarah had stopped having her womanly periods.
[[Gn 18,12]]So Sarah laughed to herself and said, "Now that I am so withered and my husband is so old, am I still to have sexual pleasure?"
[[Gn 18,13]]But the LORD said to Abraham: "Why did Sarah laugh and say, 'Shall I really bear a child, old as I am?'
[[Gn 18,14]]Is anything too marvelous for the LORD to do? At the appointed time, about this time next year, I will return to you, and Sarah will have a son."
[[Gn 18,15]]Because she was afraid, Sarah dissembled, saying, "I didn't laugh." But he said, "Yes you did."

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 8,5]]When Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion approached him and appealed to him,
[[Mt 8,6]]saying, "Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, suffering dreadfully."
[[Mt 8,7]]He said to him, "I will come and cure him."
[[Mt 8,8]]The centurion said in reply, "Lord, I am not worthy to have you enter under my roof; only say the word and my servant will be healed.
[[Mt 8,9]]For I too am a person subject to authority, with soldiers subject to me. And I say to one, 'Go,' and he goes; and to another, 'Come here,' and he comes; and to my slave, 'Do this,' and he does it."
[[Mt 8,10]]When Jesus heard this, he was amazed and said to those following him, "Amen, I say to you, in no one in Israel have I found such faith.
[[Mt 8,11]]I say to you, many will come from the east and the west, and will recline with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob at the banquet in the kingdom of heaven."
[[Mt 8,12]]but the children of the kingdom will be driven out into the outer darkness, where there will be wailing and grinding of teeth."
[[Mt 8,13]]And Jesus said to the centurion, "You may go; as you have believed, let it be done for you." And at that very hour (his) servant was healed.
[[Mt 8,14]]Jesus entered the house of Peter, and saw his mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever.
[[Mt 8,15]]He touched her hand, the fever left her, and she rose and waited on him.
[[Mt 8,16]]When it was evening, they brought him many who were possessed by demons, and he drove out the spirits by a word and cured all the sick,
[[Mt 8,17]]to fulfill what had been said by Isaiah the prophet: "He took away our infirmities and bore our diseases."

psalm.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
psalm.text:
[[Lc 1,46]]Mary said: "My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord;
[[Lc 1,47]]my spirit rejoices in God my savior.

[[Lc 1,48]]For he has looked with favor on his lowly servant; 
from this day all generations will call me blessed.
[[Lc 1,49]]The Almighty has done great things for me, 
and holy is his name.

[[Lc 1,50]]He has mercy on those who fear him
in every generation.
[[Lc 1,53]]He has filled the hungry with good things; 
and the rich he has sent away empty.

[[Lc 1,54]]He has come to the help of his servant Israel , 
remembering his promise of mercy,
[[Lc 1,55]]The promise he made to our fathers, 
to Abraham and to his descendants forever."
